p: Heel stick is the main source of blood testing in term and premature newborns. It is an invasive and painful procedure that affects newborn's future developmental and behavioral expressions. It also has long-term effects on their pain response when compared to infants who did not have such an invasive procedure ( 1, 2). Furthermore, in 2004, a study showed a specific association between parental concerns about infant's pain and parental distress ( 3).
